author: Jennifer Newton, The Sun
title: Do not do these two things if you want to fall back to sleep | New York Post
text:
There’s nothing worse than knowing you have an early start the next morning and then suddenly waking up in the middle of the night.
And then, once you are awake, sleep seems to evade you and you end up lying there wide-eyed willing yourself to drift back off.
But now a sleep specialist has revealed the two things you should never do if you suddenly wake up during the night and want to get back to sleep.
And they both involve not leaving your bed or even opening your eyes.
Dr. Michael Breus, a sleep expert and author, says the first thing you should never do if you wake up is go to the bathroom unless you really need to.
He told the Independent that when you get out of bed to stumble to the bathroom or even decide to sit up, it causes your heart rate to increase.
When drifting off to sleep, however, your heart rate lowers as you relax. So if you raise it up by going to the bathroom you’ll have a harder time knocking out the Zs again.
The second thing you should never do entails a fight against every instinct you have.
According to Breus, if you wake up, you should never reach for your phone or even look at your alarm clock for the time.
Shutterstock He explains that looking at the time causes the brain to become agitated and stressed, which are the two of the worst feelings you can have if you want to fall back asleep.
So next time you wake up in the middle of the night when you don’t want to, don’t move or even open your eyes!
